TopicTitle: Favorite Final Fantasy Game (Get out if its above 10)

Articles.Content:
Since I didn\'t grow up with anything below FFX, I have to go with Final Fantasy Dissidia. Although I can\'t read Japanese Chinese Aisian anything that isn\'t English or Canadian french, the game still kicks ass.

---Herr Presidente

I didn\'t grow up with Final Fantasy, but

FFV
Dissidia was pretty good, but I\'ll stick with VI (VII as a close second)... I still like Chrono Trigger best from the Square RPGs.

I go for Final Fantasy IX and yes I really loved the characters. Each one had a story, a background that mattered and together with the classic fighting system, the skill system (which I think was the best in whole FF history) and the epic story it made me play it 3 times and simply love every tiny piece of it.

Mmmh second one is very difficult. FFX had a very good story but the world was very linear (don\'t know the right word :-[ ). FFVIII was my first FF so it gets bonus points ;P but yes the skill system was just wrong.

Now to FFXII (there is no missing I, I really mean 12): I think the game is far better than it is handled among FF-fans. Don\'t get me wrong, the story and the characters were just boring and the fighting system new and exciting but nothing for all FFs to come. But think of the world. You are free to go everywhere and there are cities and villages with people, little stories and quests. IMHO this had could been the way a future FF could looked like (remember: only the points in the last sentence). The skill-system was also a bit more... FFIX? ;D Don\'t know how to explain but the skill system in these two FFs are my personal favourites as they are some kind of realistic.

So where is VII? It is handled as one of the best FFs and I just don\'t get it. Why? I know that this is the first FF for a lot of people, so I ask the ones who are older or played it after VIII and so on. What is the part that makes you love this game more than the other FFs? For me this game was like getting from Monkey Island III to IV. 2D on SNES looked good. Why turning to an ugly 3D engine? Of course graphics are the last important part of FF but it gave me negative points which should be compensated on other parts but where? The story is good but also had some stretched parts... Please explain it to me. I won\'t argue with you, I just want to understand
I loved FFX but I actually haven\'t played any of the others besides I and II on the Gameboy.
